name: Suite Novotel Cannes Centre

reviews.text: we spent there 2 nights. Big room, old furniture. Free internet and movies. the breakfast is great compared to the other hotel's average. In the room is an oven, a kettle with tea and coffee. have not given us the crib because they had no more ..... is a defect in the chain (see other review). Parking available (expensive) and there's a small emergency food shop downstairs. Quite good location in Cannes

Just got back from a one night stay. Some excellent points and some not so good. The parking is reasonably priced (8 euros for 24 hours) and in an underground car park under the hotel (easy parking, but not an easy up/down ramp if you have a larger car). The rooms are inexpensive. We paid 90 euros.The staff are all friendly and very helpful. A couple of great details like free 15 minute chair massages in the reception area on Thursday evenings and, apparently, free use of a Smart car if you ask ahead (we didn't need this service) are also very nice. The bar area is pleasant and the whole hotel is clean. The room/suite was quite spacious and we liked the fact that the table was large and on wheels, so you could move it around according to your needs. Same with the TV. Also plenty of room to put a baby cot and to let children play on the floor if you're travelling with little ones. Mini fridge with two free bottles of water, and a few nice touches like tea, coffee and hot chocolate along with a microwave (microwave meals and yoghurts etc. for sale in the lobby) also nice. Toilet separate from bathroom, which makes life easier if you're sharing a room. Also bathtub separate from shower.
reviews.title: A mixed bag
Our stay
reviews.text: Bad points: it was absolutely boiling hot! I've had this problem before with Accor chain hotels (Mercur, Ibis...) in the winter, when the AC is switched off and for some reason warm air is circulated through the whole hotel. This is fine when you're stepping out of the shower, but infernal at night, given that you can only open one window a crack. Temp hovered around 25 degrees C (77 F) we reckoned. Pillows not great, though beds were fine. Soap/shampoo in the shower was marked clearly with 'avoid contact with eyes' so you might want to give that a miss.The other thing is breakfast. Frankly, avoid it. 13 euros for a few small things that felt like afterthoughts (the only tea on the buffet was mint, the grapes were brown, there were no bowls whatsoever available to put one of the two cereals in, the plates were cardboard....) is a bit scandalous. Have had much better buffet breakfasts at Ibises and Mercures in general, so this was odd. Best to venture out and find a cafè.
Overall a good experience though, and good value for money.
reviews.title: Good value for money in an expensive city

reviews.text: Large clean modern suit. On a main street, but back room was quiet. Covered parking for fee. Ten minutes walking to downtown. Patisserie and grocery down the street. Easy access from highway. Good value.
reviews.title: Good quality beds but the rest is a bit too much plastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ok, so first of all, Cannes wasn't my favourite place. We're Australian and have the best beaches in the world so that part of the south of France didn't impress us. Plus it was just a big city that was quite over priced- expected, but at times unnecessary. In saying that, we still had a nice stay in Cannes & in the Suite Novotel. We found the staff very helpful and very good English (which is hard to find in France). Parking was 8€ per day which is quite good considering how expensive everything else is and the maniac drivers. The rooms were very nice & spacious. Although beware, our room said queen plus single- the queen was great but if you do have a 3rd person, the single is a small day bed with no sheets. The room had a great bathroom, microwave, safe, bar fridge- pretty good if you're self catering like we were. I have read other reviews & a few mentioned the air con not working. We stayed in October & it wasn't hot, however we still found the rooms a little stuffy and the air con didn't help much so there could be some good truth to this. But if you're staying in the colder months- no worries. Also, we had breakfast included in the price, but if you have the choice to pay for it- you'll probably get better value going to the gorgeous patisserie just a few doors down (breakfast was nothing special). All in all, we felt we definitely got value for money!
reviews.title: Would have no problem staying here again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Enjoyed our stay. Reception staff friendly. Big room (double bed, single bed, desk area, kitchen area with microwave and fridge). Free movies. Good air-conditioning. Big shower. Walking distance to main parts - 10 minutes. Tiny negative point - one lift for whole hotel. Recommend going up the hill on the bus for 5 minutes to Le Cannet and finding Place Bellvue for lovely restaurants, picturesque streets, good views. Buses only cost 1 euro a trip. We walked back down from Le Cannet which was only a 30 minute walk. This is a good value, clean hotel for Cannes close to all amenities but no balcony, view, pool etc but we knew this and weren't having that sort of break anyway.
reviews.title: overall good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel lives up to previous reviews, being easily the best Suite hotel in which we have stayed and very conveniently located within walking distance of the railway station, marina and main shopping district as well as numerous bars and restaurants, supermarkets and off-licences. There is a bus stop just outside the hotel. The public areas are decorated in a pleasingly quirky mismatch of armchairs and cushions, while the bedrooms are of the usual high Novotel standard of convenience and cleanliness. Unlike the Marrakech Suite Novotel, this room was kept well supplied with soap, tea, coffee and biscuits. Breakfast is a little strange because in addition to the usual bread, croissants, butter and jam there are little refridgerated pots which appear to contain substances similar to laboratory specimens and described as 'healthy'. Some are tasty, others less so.
reviews.title: Cannes is still a pleasantly old-fashioned French town

reviews.text: I am big fan of Novotel hotels and try to book them where possible. In fact during our most recent Europe road trip, we booked Novotel in Metz, Montecarlo, Cannes and Dijon.

aka: Suite Novotel Cannes Centre Hotel Cannes
description: 3 star hotel with 124 inviting 30 m² suites. Enjoy our free unlimited Suitebox service incl. hardwired high speed internet, calls to landlines within France, video and music on demand, multimedia area with chat, music, photos etc. 5 minutes from La Croisette, the Palais des Festivals, the city centre and the train station. 24 hr services including Boutique Gourmande refreshments, fitness area, business corner. Bar, free massages on Thursdays and undercover pay parking. Accessible facilities.
